name: Dry Red Beans in the Instant Pot®
author: LauraF
summary: I don't buy canned beans anymore; I use my pressure cooker to cook them from dry every time. I don't even have to think about soaking them ahead of time, since that's not needed. If you do decide to soak, check your appliance manual because cooking time will be shorter.
directions: Pour beans into a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®)
Cover with a few inches of cool water
Select Manual; set timer for 28 minutes on high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions
Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build
Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, 10 to 40 minutes
